get.description:
Fetch players.

If you send a cookie that shows you're "logged in", and you happen to have permissions for
managing bans, the response will include IP addresses.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

is_banned.description: Whether the player is currently banned.

post.description:
Register a new player.

This endpoint will be hit by CS2 servers whenever an unknown player joins.

get.description:
Fetch a specific player.

If you send a cookie that shows you're "logged in", and you happen to have permissions for
managing bans, the response will include the player's IP address.

schema.description: Players are usually identified by their [SteamID], which is unique, or their name.

is_banned.description: Whether the player is currently banned.

patch.description:
Updates information about a player.

This endpoint will be hit periodically by CS2 servers whenever a map changes, or a player
disconnects.

get.summary: Fetch in-game preference settings for a specific player.
get.description:
Fetch in-game preference settings for a specific player.

This is used by CS2 servers for keeping settings in sync across multiple servers.

schema.description: Players are usually identified by their [SteamID], which is unique, or their name.

get.description:
Fetch maps.

Any maps returned by this endpoint are currently, or have been previously, accepted into the
global map pool.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

items.description:
A KZ map.

The only reason this is named `FullMap` instead of just `Map`, is because `utoipa` macros are
stupid.

mappers.description: List of players who have contributed to the creation of this map.

courses.description: List of courses on this map.

put.description:
Create / update a map.

This is used whenever a new map is approved, or an existing map receives breaking changes.

get.description: Fetch a single map.

schema.description: Maps are either identified by their ID, which is unique, or their name.

A KZ map.

The only reason this is named `FullMap` instead of just `Map`, is because `utoipa` macros are
stupid.

mappers.description: List of players who have contributed to the creation of this map.

courses.description: List of courses on this map.

patch.description:
Update a specific map.

This endpoint is used for non-breaking changes, i.e. changes that do not change the
**gameplay** of a map in a backwards-incompatible way. This could include the map's name,
filters, mappers, etc.

get.description:
Fetch servers.

Servers returned by this endpoint are officially approved CS2 servers that you can play on to
submit records.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

ip_address.description: The server's IP address and port.

get.description: Fetch a specific server.

ip_address.description: The server's IP address and port.

patch.description:
Update a server.

This endpoint can be used by both admins and server owners.

post.summary: Generate a temporary authentication key for a CS2 server.
post.description:
Generate a temporary authentication key for a CS2 server.

CS2 servers will use this endpoint together with their refresh key, to generate temporary
access keys, which will then be included in any following requests.

See `CS2 Servers` in `ARCHITECTURE.md` in the repository root for more details.

put.summary: Generate a new refresh key for a server.
put.description:
Generate a new refresh key for a server.

It will immediately invalidate the old **refresh** key, but cannot invalidate **access** keys,
as those are JWTs with set expiration dates.

This endpoint can be used by both admins and server owners.

delete.description:
Delete a server's refresh key.

This can be used to effectively "de-global" server. Keep in mind though, that any previously
generated access keys are not invalidated, and will expire naturally.

This endpoint can only be hit by admins.

get.description: Fetch jumpstats.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

strafes.description: The amount of strafes done in this jump.

sync.description: The % of how much airtime was spent gaining speed.

max.description: The maximum speed during the jump.

overlap.description: The % of how much airtime was spent pressing both directional keys at once.

bad_angles.description: The % of how much airtime keys were pressed but no speed was gained.

dead_air.description: The % of how much airtime was spent not gaining speed.

height.description: The maximum height during this jump (in units).

airpath.description:
How close to a perfect airpath this jump was.

The closer to 1.0 the better.

deviation.description: How far the landing point deviates from the jumpoff point.

get.summary: Fetch a specific jumpstat by its ID.
get.description: Fetch a specific jumpstat by its ID.

strafes.description: The amount of strafes done in this jump.

sync.description: The % of how much airtime was spent gaining speed.

max.description: The maximum speed during the jump.

overlap.description: The % of how much airtime was spent pressing both directional keys at once.

bad_angles.description: The % of how much airtime keys were pressed but no speed was gained.

dead_air.description: The % of how much airtime was spent not gaining speed.

height.description: The maximum height during this jump (in units).

airpath.description:
How close to a perfect airpath this jump was.

The closer to 1.0 the better.

deviation.description: How far the landing point deviates from the jumpoff point.

get.summary: Fetch the replay file for a specific jumpstat.
get.description: Fetch the replay file for a specific jumpstat.
Fetch records.

parameters.name: teleports
parameters.description: Filter by whether teleports where used.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sort by a specific property.

Defaults to "date".

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description:
Decide the sorting order.

Defaults to "ascending".

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

styles.description: The style(s) this run was performed in.

teleports.description: The amount of teleports used during this run.

post.description:
Create a new record.

This is used by CS2 servers to submit new records.

get.description: Fetch "personal best" records.

parameters.name: teleports
parameters.description: Filter by whether teleports where used.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sort by a specific property.

Defaults to "date".

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description:
Decide the sorting order.

Defaults to "ascending".

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

styles.description: The style(s) this run was performed in.

teleports.description: The amount of teleports used during this run.

get.summary: Fetch a specific record by its ID.
get.description: Fetch a specific record by its ID.

styles.description: The style(s) this run was performed in.

teleports.description: The amount of teleports used during this run.

get.summary: Fetch the replay file for a specific record.
get.description: Fetch the replay file for a specific record.

Fetch bans.

These are bans that might have expired / have been reverted. If that's the case, they will also
include the according "unban" entry.

parameters.name: unbanned
parameters.description: Filter by bans that have already been reverted.

parameters.name: banned_by
parameters.description: Filter by admins responseible for bans.

parameters.name: unbanned_by
parameters.description: Filter by admins responseible for unbans.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

post.description:
Ban a player.

This endpoint can be used by both CS2 servers and admins.

get.summary: Fetch a specific ban by its ID.
get.description: Fetch a specific ban by its ID.

patch.description:
Update a ban's details.

Note that this is **not** used for _reverting_ bans. Use `DELETE /bans/{ban_id}` for that.

get.summary: Fetch a specific game session by its ID.
get.description: Fetch a specific game session by its ID.

Log in with Steam.

This will redirect to Steam, and after you login, you will be sent back to `/auth/callback`,
and then to whatever the `redirect_to` query parameter is set to. A cookie with a session ID
will be inserted.

parameters.name: redirect_to
parameters.description: Where the user wants to be redirected to after the login process is done.

get.description:
Log out again.

This will invalidate your current session and delete your cookie.
If you wish to invalidate all other existing sessions as well, set
`invalidate_all_sessions=true`.

parameters.name: invalidate_all_sessions
parameters.description: Whether *all* previous sessions should be invalidated.

get.summary: The callback endpoint that will be hit by Steam after a successful login.
get.description: The callback endpoint that will be hit by Steam after a successful login.
Fetch admins (players with permissions).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

get.summary: Fetch a specific admin by their SteamID.
get.description: Fetch a specific admin by their SteamID.

put.description:
Create / update an admin's permissions.

This will completely replace their previous set of permissions!

get.description: Fetch cs2kz plugin versions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results.

total.description: The total amount of available results.

post.summary: Create a new cs2kz plugin version.
post.description:
Create a new cs2kz plugin version.

This endpoint is intended to be used by GitHub CI for new releases.

BanReason.description: The different reasons for which players can be banned.

expires_on.description:
A new expiration date.

Not specifying this at all means the expiration date will not be modified.
If this is explicitly `null`, the expiration date will be deleted and the ban counts as
permanent.

BhopStats.description: Bhop statistics over a certain time period.

tick0.description: The amount of scrolls at the exact same tick the player hit the ground.

tick1.description: The amount of scrolls 1 tick after the player hit the ground.

tick2.description: The amount of scrolls 2 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick3.description: The amount of scrolls 3 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick4.description: The amount of scrolls 4 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick5.description: The amount of scrolls 5 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick6.description: The amount of scrolls 6 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick7.description: The amount of scrolls 7 ticks after the player hit the ground.

tick8.description: The amount of scrolls 8 ticks after the player hit the ground.

mappers.description: List of players who have contributed to the creation of this course.

added_mappers.description: Players to be added as mappers of this course.

removed_mappers.description: Players to be removed as mappers of this course.

filter_updates.description: Updates to any filters of this course.

teleports.description: The "runtype" this filter applies to (whether teleports are used or not).

GameSession.description:
An in-game session.

Game sessions are recorded while players are playing on global servers, and submitted whenever
a player disconnects or when the map changes.
